s.text: President Clinton, the paper reports, is making a rare congressional working visit to plump for his party's bill, which unlike the GOP alternative, would strike down a 25-year-old ban against patients suing their health plans.
So Special Agent Larry Cockell might be at the federal courthouse this morning to answer Starr's questions, although the Post says Cockell may be advised not to show up.
So Special Agent Larry Cockell might be at the federal courthouse this morning to answer Starr's questions, although the Post says Cockell may be advised not to show up.
Indeed, the paper reports that the judge "harshly chastised" the Secret Service for continuing to fight Kenneth Starr on this point.
The WP is much calmer--calling the Senate hearing "a familiar scene," and putting it on p.
The WP is much calmer--calling the Senate hearing "a familiar scene," and putting it on p.
